definition.name: NXIVtemp
definition.doc: Draft application definition for temperature dependent IV curve measurements. In this application definition, times should be specified always together with a UTC offset.

symbols.doc: Variables used throughout the document, e.g. dimensions and important parameters

symbol.name: N_data_points
symbol.doc: Number of elements in the scanned voltage array

symbol.name: N_variables
symbol.doc: Number of additional variables that are changed with the temperature (can be understood as columns next to the temperature)

symbol.name: N_different_temperatures
symbol.doc: Number of different temperatures that are set

group.doc: This is the application definition describing temperature dependent IV curve measurements. For this a temperature is set. After reaching the temperature a voltage sweep is performed and for each voltage a current is measured. Then the next desired temperature is set and an IV measurement is performed. The application definition defines: - elements of the experimental instrument - calibration information if available - parameters used to tune the state of the sample - sample description

field.name: definition
field.doc: An application definition for temperature dependent IV curve measurements.

attribute.name: version
attribute.doc: Version number to identify which definition of this application definition was used for this entry/data.

attribute.name: url
attribute.doc: URL where to find further material (documentation, examples) relevant to the application definition

field.name: experiment_identifier
field.doc: Unique identifier of the experiment, such as a (globally persistent) unique identifier. - The identifier is usually defined by the facility or principle investigator. - The identifier enables to link experiments to e.g. proposals.

field.name: experiment_description
field.doc: Description of the exact experiment performed.

field.name: start_time
field.doc: UTC offset should be specifiec.

field.name: program
field.doc: Commercial or otherwise defined given name to the program that was used to generate the results file(s) with measured data and metadata (or a link to the instrument software).

attribute.name: version
attribute.doc: Either version with build number, commit hash, or description of a (online) repository where the source code of the program and build instructions can be found so that the program can be configured in such a way that result files can be created ideally in a deterministic manner.

group.name: operator
group.doc: Contact information of at least the user of the instrument or the investigator who performed this experiment. Adding multiple users if relevant is recommended.

field.name: affiliation
field.doc: Name of the affiliation of the user at the point in time when the experiment was performed.

field.name: address
field.doc: Full address (street, street number, ZIP, city, country) of the user's affiliation.

field.name: email
field.doc: Email address of the user.

field.name: orcid
field.doc: Author ID defined by https://orcid.org/.

field.name: telephone_number
field.doc: Official telephone number of the user.

group.doc: General properties of the temperature dependent IV curve measurements equipment

group.name: IVvoltage_source
group.doc: Specify the used voltage source used in the voltage sweep for the IV measurement.

field.name: model
field.doc: Free-text desribing the model and make of the voltage source which is used for the IV sweep measurement

field.name: name
field.doc: Custom name of the voltage source for the IV sweep given by the user/institution

field.name: measurement
field.doc: Free-text describing the measurement performed in a few words

field.name: type
field.doc: Free-text describing the type of voltage setting: an internal sweep using the functionality of the voltage supply, or a set/wait/read/repeat mechanism.

group.name: IVcurrent_source
group.doc: Specify the used current source used in the voltage sweep for the IV measurement.

field.name: model
field.doc: Free-text desribing the model and make of the current source which is used for the IV sweep measurement

field.name: name
field.doc: Custom name of the current source for the IV sweep given by the user/institution

field.name: measurement
field.doc: Free-text describing the measurement performed in a few words

field.name: type
field.doc: Free-text describing the type of current measuring: an internal sweep using the functionality of the voltage supply, or a set/wait/read/repeat mechanism.

group.name: calibration
group.doc: Calibration of the temperature sensor is possible

field.name: calibration_time
field.doc: ISO8601 datum when calibration was last performed before this measurement. UTC offset should be specifiec.

group.name: temperature_control
group.doc: Describes the system for controlling the temperature if temperature control was used.

field.name: type
field.doc: What kind of temperature control was used? PID, custom temp control?

group.name: PID_settings
group.doc: K_p, K_i, and K_d values used for the temperature control

field.name: K_p_value
field.doc: Proportional term. The proportional term produces an output value that is proportional to the current error value. The proportional response can be adjusted by multiplying the error by a constant Kp, called the proportional gain constant.

field.name: K_i_value
field.doc: The contribution from the integral term is proportional to both the magnitude of the error and the duration of the error. The integral in a PID controller is the sum of the instantaneous error over time and gives the accumulated offset that should have been corrected previously. The accumulated error is then multiplied by the integral gain (Ki) and added to the controller output

field.name: K_d_value
field.doc: The derivative of the process error is calculated by determining the slope of the error over time and multiplying this rate of change by the derivative gain K_d. The magnitude of the contribution of the derivative term to the overall control action is termed the derivative gain, K_d

field.name: temp_sensor
field.doc: Describes the temperature sensor that was used

field.name: other_temp_sensor
field.doc: If you specified 'other' as temperature sensor, please write down what it is.

group.name: temp_calculation
group.doc: Describes the way the temperature is determined from a measured value

field.name: raw_temp_data
field.doc: Data of the most principal measurement of the temperature. For example resistance of a Pt1000.

field.name: conversion_function
field.doc: Algebraic function to determine temperature from the raw_temp_data. All values are in SI units.

group.doc: Properties of the sample, its history, the sample environment and experimental conditions (e.g. surrounding medium, temperature, pressure etc.), along with the data (data type, wavelength array, measured data).

field.name: sample_name
field.doc: Descriptive name of the sample

field.name: sample_history
field.doc: Ideally, a reference to the location or a unique (globally persistent) identifier (e.g.) of e.g. another file which gives as many as possible details of the material, its microstructure. In the case that such a detailed history of the sample is not available, use this field as a free-text description to specify details of the sample and its preparation.

field.name: preparation_date
field.doc: ISO 8601 date with time zone specified. UTC offset should be specifiec.

field.name: data_identifier
field.doc: An identifier to correlate data to the experimental conditions, if several were used in this measurement; typically an index of 0 - N

field.name: measured_data
field.doc: Resulting data from the measurement, described by data type.

field.name: environment_conditions
field.doc: External parameters that have influenced the sample.

field.name: varied_parameters
field.doc: Indicates which parameter was changed. Its definition must exist below. The specified variable has to be number_of_runs long, providing the parameters for each data set.

group.name: plot
group.doc: A default view of the data. The current (y-axis) should be plotted against the voltage (x-axis) with color coding for the temperature of each IV-curve

attribute.name: axes
attribute.doc: We recommend to use voltage as a default attribute
